constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 103 (Thursday, June 16, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. LaMALFA:
H.R. 8115.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Clause 2 of Section 3 of Article IV of the U.S.
Constitution: ``The Congress shall have power to dispose of
and make all needful rules and regulations respecting the
territory or other property belonging to the United States;
and nothing in this Constitution shall be so construed as to
prejudice any claims of the United States, or of any
particular state.''
[Page H5646]

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 501.

title: Recreation and Public Purposes Tribal Parity Act
